articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Air and Anti-air Force Command of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Air and Anti-air Force Command of KPA
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, inspected the Air and Anti-air Force Command of the KPA. 
					 Accompanying him were senior officials of the party and army Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Chol Hae, Pak To Chun, Son Chol Ju, Pak Jae Gyong, Ri Jae Il, Kim Myong Guk and Hwang Pyong So. He was greeted on the spot by KPA General Ri Pyong Chol, commander of the air and anti-air forces of the KPA, KPA Lieutenant General Son Chong Nam and other generals and officers. 
					
					 After receiving a salute, he looked round the room devoted to the education of servicepersons through revolutionary relics and the room devoted to the history.
					
					 After seeing historical data, he said with deep emotion that the air force of the heroic KPA was born and could grow to be invincible and matchless ranks thanks to the outstanding military thoughts and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The air force of the KPA has glorious today as the President organized the flying corps of new Korea right after the liberation, he noted, taking a measure for setting November 29 as the Day of Air Men to commemorate the day of the founding of the flying corps forever.
					
					 Learning that there were among the participants in the Vietnam War hero pilots who died in the motherland after returning home, he saw to it that their bodies were buried at the cemetery of fallen heroes of the KPA.
					
					 Going round the command post and operation study rooms then, he learned in detail about the unit's performance of duty and combat tasks.
					
					 He highly estimated the achievements made by the commanding officers and service personnel of the Air and Anti-air Force Command, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they are defending the sky of the country as firm as an iron wall by firmly arming themselves with the WPK's Juche-based war methods and acquiring high operational command ability and combat capability to fight a modern war.
					
					 After watching the service personnel in tears of emotion after writing with care the letters "Comrade Supreme Commander, we've longed to see you, indeed" on the display recording circumstances at the command post, he called them close to him.
					
					 He warmly hugged the service personnel jumping for joy after rushing, calling "Comrade Supreme Commander!" in a choked tone. He had a photo taken with them.
					
					 Making the rounds of each room of the operation study room for a good chunk of time, he praised the command for successfully building the rooms in such a manner as to deeply study and thoroughly apply the WPK's Juche-based military strategic and tactical ideas and war methods.
					
					 The air force has a very important role to play in firmly defending the socialist country from the encroachment of the enemy, he said, setting forth the important tasks which would serve as guidelines for bolstering up the air and anti-air forces of the country.
					
					 He went round the servicepersons' hall, servicepersons' health complex, mess hall of the command and other entertainment and educational facilities and supply service facilities.
					
					 Saying that he was pleased with everything and there is nothing defective, he gave the unit the highest appreciation that it is the most exemplary one in the whole army.
					
					 Watching cooks standing in tears of emotion, he appreciated their efforts, kindly called them and had a photo taken with them, too.
					
					 He looked at the combat and technical apparatuses contrived and developed by the unit itself.
					
					 After being briefed in detail on the performance and introduction of combat and technical apparatuses, he said that this good job can be done only by the service personnel who are using their brains to round off the combat preparations and working heart and soul for them. He asked commanding officers to convey his words that he highly estimated the service personnel who took part in their research and development.
					
					 He once again highly appreciated the enterprising work style of the officers of the unit with which they are making uninterrupted innovations and making leap forward while planning and conducting all the military and political work on a high level true to the WPK's idea of pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology. 
					
					 He had a photo session with the service personnel of the unit, expressing expectation and conviction that they would firmly defend with arms the socialist country advancing for final victory, keeping themselves in a posture fully ready to go into action.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs to People from All Walks of Life
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs to People from All Walks of Life
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent his autographs on April 27 in reply to the letters from officials and other working people in different units and teachers, researchers and students. In their letters they referred to their pride of being members of the sun's nation as they hold in high esteem the great persons of Mt. Paektu reflecting their ardent loyalty on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They are teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University, employees and patients of the Hospital of Pyongyang College of Medicine of Kim Il Sung University, workers of the North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex, officials and employees of the Mansudae Art Studio, the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee and Kaeson Youth Park Management Station, residents in Tongmyongsan-dong in Wonsan City and teachers and students of Masan Secondary School in Waudo District, Nampho City. They in their letters expressed their great joy and excitement of greeting the new century of Kim Il Sung' nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea, being blessed with the illustrious leaders and the sun generation after generation. 
					
					 They heard the speech made by Kim Jong Un at the military parade for celebrating the Day of the Sun to encourage all the service personnel and people to live and work as befitting descendants of Kim Il Sung and soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il, they said. 
					
					 They vowed to always remain faithful to Kim Jong Un and contribute to building a thriving nation with great achievements in their work.

articles.title: Talks between SPA Chairman and President of Lao National Assembly Held
articles.content:
Talks between SPA Chairman and President of Lao National Assembly Held
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, and Pany Yathortou, president of the Lao National Assembly, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the SPA, Song Ja Rip, chairman of the DPRK-Laos friendship parliamentary group, and officials concerned and from the Lao side the members of the delegation of the Lao National Assembly and Kiettisak Keobanhdith, Lao ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the matter of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two assemblies and the issues of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: DPRK SPA Hosts Reception for Lao Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK SPA Hosts Reception for Lao Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK hosted a reception for the visiting delegation of the National Assembly of the People's Democratic Republic of Laos at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the Lao National Assembly delegation headed by President Pany Yathortou, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP), and Ambassador Kiettisak Keobanhdith and staff members of the Lao embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Chairman of the DPRK SPA Choe Thae Bok and its Vice Chairwoman Hong Son Ok, Chairman of DPRK-Laos Friendship Parliamentary Group Song Ja Rip and officials concerned.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok in his speech said the delegation's visit to the DPRK would offer an important occasion for furthering the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and Kaysone Phomvihane.
					
					 He said the Lao people are making big efforts to build a people's democratic system suited to the specific conditions of their country under the guidance of the LPRP.
					
					 The two countries have closely supported and co-operated with each other in their common cause to defend the banner of independence, banner of socialism, he noted.
					
					 Pany Yathortou said that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by President Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung is growing strong day by day.
					
					 Visiting different places, we witnessed the achievements made by the Korean people and the might of the DPRK's armed forces under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people, she noted.
					
					 She wished the Korean people greater successes in defending the country and accelerating economic construction under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, true to the ideas and cause of the leaders.

articles.title: Lao National Assembly Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Lao National Assembly Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the National Assembly of the People's Democratic Republic of Laos led by President Pany Yathortou, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP), visited Mangyongdae on Thursday. 
					 At the old home of President Kim Il Sung the members of the delegation looked round the historic relics preserved there with care, being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of the President and his family members in Mangyongdae. 
					
					 They had a photo taken before the old home. 
					
					 The head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book that she was pleased to visit the old home of the President. The President was a close friend of the Lao people, she wrote, and went on:
					
					 Through visit to Mangyongdae we could know well about the fact that the President brought about freedom and independence to the Korean people. 
					
					 This serves as good base for education of posterity. 
					
					 I believe Mangyongdae will be remembered for all ages in the hearts of the world people.  
					
					 The delegation also visited the e-library and indoor swimming pool of Kim Il Sung University, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and the Exhibition of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Lao National Assembly Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Lao National Assembly Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the National Assembly of the People's Democratic Republic of Laos visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday.
					 The delegation laid a floral basket before the statues in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men who made immortal contributions to global independence, and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Participants in Medical Symposium Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Participants in Medical Symposium Pay Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 14th Pyongyang symposium on medical science of Koreans at home and abroad visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before their statues in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Russian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on May 3.
					 Kim had a talk with him after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Visits Different Parts of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Visits Different Parts of Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan-DPRK Friendship Kyoto Net headed by Director Michihiro Sasaki visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University.
					 The members of the delegation went round the reading hall, computer education room, science exchange room, distance lecture room, general lecture room, etc.
					
					 After the visit the head of the delegation said he admired the successfully built e-library, expressing hope that the Korean people would achieve big successes in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 The delegation also visited Kim Jong Suk Nursery, the Grand People's Study House, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and other places.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Japanese Figure
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Japanese Figure
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class was awarded to Mamoru Suemoto, director of the Japan-DPRK Friendship Kyoto Net for the Promotion of Cultural, Scientific and Civilian Exchange.
					 He has supported the Korean people in their just cause of building a thriving socialist nation and achieving national reunification and worked hard for developing the friendly relations with the DPRK.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Honorary Professorship and Doctorate Awarded to Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Honorary Professorship and Doctorate Awarded to Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Honorary professorship and doctorate were conferred on overseas Koreans with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday.
					 Honorary professorship went to Kim Il U, advisor of the Korean Health Workers Association in Japan, and honorary doctorate to Kim Yong Il, chairman of the Korean Health Workers Association in Japan, Kim Yun Bom, chairman of the Medical Science Committee of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., and Pak Mun Jae, vice-chairman of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S.
					
					 They made a contribution to the development of medical science and technology in the homeland by taking part several times in Pyongyang symposiums on medical science of Koreans at home and abroad.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts under Fire by CPRK
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Outbursts under Fire by CPRK
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak was reported to have cried out for "strongly reacting to any provocation of the north, not tolerating it" before riff-raffs of the "Consultative Council of Democracy and Peaceful Unification" at Chongwadae on April 30. He talked the nonsense that he "does not want arms race but stands for peaceful race." This traitor, at the same time, trumpeted about "confrontation of the systems", talking about "wind of change", "trend of history" and the like.
					 His spate of rigmaroles came under fire by Information Bulletin No. 997 released by the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) Thursday. 
					
					 What the traitor uttered is no more than ridiculous jargons to save his face after being badly beaten by the sky-high spirit of the army and people of the DPRK and their bitter condemnation of his group for daring hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership. This was also aimed to encourage his clan in the grip of uneasiness and fear, evade the responsibility for escalating tensions and divert elsewhere the public attention, the bulletin said, and continued:
					
					 His reckless remarks are no more than the last-ditch efforts to save regime from ruin and realize his scenario for invading the north through the zealous pursuance of his bankrupt policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Peaceful race, not arms race touted by the traitor is no more than rhetoric made by a psychopath unable to discern direction.
					
					 The puppet group perpetrated such hideous provocations as hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, not content with stepping up its arms buildup and staging madcap war exercises together with the U.S. everyday after begging it to keep its imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea. The group, therefore, has neither justification nor qualification to talk about "peaceful race."
					
					 If the group of traitors eagerly wants confrontation and war, the DPRK will let the provokers experience what the strikes of Songun are like.
					
					 The Lee group had better behave itself, aware that the DPRK's special actions had been declared.

articles.title: Construction of Tanchon Port Completed
articles.content:
Construction of Tanchon Port Completed
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A modern trading port made its appearance in the area of Tanchon in South Hamgyong Province on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's birth.
					 The construction of the port with a cargo traffic capacity of millions of tons provides a guarantee for greatly contributing to developing the nation's foreign trade and improving the people's living standard.
					
					 A ceremony for the completion of the construction was held on the spot Thursday. 
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kwak Pom Gi, Ro Tu Chol and other officials concerned, officials of the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, builders and working people of industrial establishments in Tanchon City.
					
					 Read out there was a joint congratulatory message sent by the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Cabinet of the DPRK to the officials and members of shock brigades who performed labor feats in the construction of the port.
					
					 The message highly praised them for successfully building another giant structure in the era of Songun greatly conducive to building an economic power true to the life-time desires and last instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It expressed belief that they would perform greater feats in the efforts for the country's prosperity united close around the WPK Central Committee headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Minister of Land and Marine Transport Kang Jong Gwan, in his speech made for the occasion, said the construction of the port was a brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who initiated the construction of the port and worked heart and soul to translate the desire of the President into a reality till the last moments of his revolutionary life and the clear-sighted guidance and meticulous care of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Speakers at the ceremony pledged themselves to carry out their tasks including dredging in a short span of time in the same spirit as displayed in the construction of the port. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round different places of the port.

articles.title: Nampho-Pyongyang Seawater Pipeline
articles.content:
Nampho-Pyongyang Seawater Pipeline
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The project for laying the Nampho-Pyongyang seawater pipeline has been completed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Choe Sok San, department director of the Ministry of Urban Management, told KCNA:
					
					 "The two-phase project covered scores-of-kilometer-long earth digging and pipeline laying and construction of pressurized pumping stations, seawater storage tank and reservoir.
					
					 The project made it possible to always supply the Pyongyang citizens with fresh drinking water."
					
					 Kim Tong Gun, department director of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, said:
					
					 "Leader Kim Jong Il initiated laying seawater pipeline between Nampho and Pyongyang in his lifetime, clearly indicating the tasks and ways to that effect.
					
					 The pipelined seawater will be used for disinfecting water, making kimchi (pickled vegetables) in winter season and producing essential foodstuff in Pyongyang.
					
					 The pipeline will also carry seawater to the Dolphin Aquarium now under construction on Rungna Islet in Taedong River flowing across the central part of Pyongyang."
					
					 Jong Ung, deputy curator of the Central Zoo, said the seawater supplied to the zoo's aquarium greatly helps breed rare sea fishes in a more desirable way.

articles.title: National Scientific, Technological Festival Closes
articles.content:
National Scientific, Technological Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological festival was closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Thursday. It was opened in celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Presented to the festival were more than 580 scientific research and technical innovation achievements selected from ministries and national institutions and provincial festivals.
					
					 Exchanged there were valuable research achievements and experience gained by scientists, technicians and working people across the country in the process of putting the national economy on Juche, modern and IT basis and developing technological and basic engineering in important fields including the key basic technology.
					
					 A national technical innovation contest among April 15 technical innovation shock brigades was reviewed.
					
					 The closing ceremony underlined the need for the scientists, technicians, officials and other working people to discharge their duty in building an economic power, bearing deep in mind the aphorism of the dear respected Kim Jong Un that the single-minded unity and invincible military capabilities plus the industrial revolution in the new century means entirely a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Ri Ja Bang, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and working people.

articles.title: Guidelines for National Reunification
articles.content:
Guidelines for National Reunification
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Forty years has passed since President Kim Il Sung laid down the three principles for Korea's reunification.
					 On May 3, Juche 61 (1972), the President met representatives of south Korea who visited Pyongyang to attend the north-south high-level political talks. In his talk with them he set forth the three principles for national reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity. 
					
					 The three principles are a programme that clarifies the way for smoothly achieving Korea's reunification in line with the will and desire of the nation.
					
					 With these principles, a common reunification programme, the Koreans could bring about a new turn in the struggle for national reunification. 
					
					 On the basis of the principles, the President advanced a proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation.
					
					 Under his energetic guidance and devoted efforts, the reunification movement made long strides despite the separatist forces' persistent moves for confrontation and war and the country's peace and security of the nation were reliably defended.
					
					 The President's idea and line of national reunification had been carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles, the 10-point programme of great national unity and the DFRK founding proposal as the three charters for national reunification. He also provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, great guidelines for the independent reunification of the nation, and the October 4 declaration, its action programme.
					
					 The great feats the President and the leader performed for national reunification will remain forever.

articles.title: IT Activities Brisk in North Phyongan Province
articles.content:
IT Activities Brisk in North Phyongan Province
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- North Phyongan Province is directing big efforts to putting its economy on an IT basis.
					 Kim Yong Gil, an official of the province, told KCNA:
					
					 "The provincial computer centre was built in Sinuiju City on a modern basis and similar ones in all other cities and counties of the province.
					
					 The province dispatched many IT experts to production fields and educational and scientific agencies. They are now making achievements in solving technical problems in production and development of education and science.
					
					 Production processes and management activities have been put on an IT basis at many factories and farms of the province, including the Amnokgang Combined Foodstuff Factory.
					
					 Educational aid system program and automatic lighting system program have been applied to several universities, schools and cultural houses.
					
					 In the future, too, we will direct big efforts to developing IT industry to make a great contribution to building a thriving nation."

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Idea on Sports Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Idea on Sports Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's Juche-oriented idea on sports took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					 Kim Jong Il advanced the idea of displaying speed, high technique and strong fighting spirit with ideological awareness in sports education, training and games.
					
					 Delivered at the seminar were instructions given by Kim Jong Il on the idea.
					
					 Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Mun Jae Dok, president of the Academy of Sports Science, and other speakers said the sports idea set forth by Kim Jong Il most correctly reflects the actual conditions in which the drive to build a sports power is progressing apace on the basis of the indomitable mental power of Kim Il Sung's nation and ideological and moral traits, temper and special physical characteristics of the Korean sportspersons. 
					
					 They underscored the need for officials in the field of sports and players and coaches to give free rein to Korean-style rules and methods in every match to make positive contributions to building a renowned football power and a sports power.
					
					 Present at the seminar were Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Pak Myong Chol, officials in the field of sports and coaches and researchers.

articles.title: Space Conquest Inviolable Sovereign Right
articles.content:
Space Conquest Is Inviolable Sovereign Right
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Mankind in the 21st century entered the great era of outer space.
					 Over a hundred nations have acceded to the Outer Space Treaty and buckled down to conquering space. 
					
					 Space development has become an indispensable element for state development because space conquest is a symbol of a country's prosperity and sovereignty.
					
					 A satellite is a complex of science and technology and, especially its launch technology is part of ultra modern science and technology including the technology of separating satellite from a carrier rocket.
					
					 Since the former Soviet Union successfully launched its satellite on October 4, 1957 for the first time, various countries have set about developing space. The number of satellites and space vehicles put by various countries into orbit by the end of 1989 reached 3 960. 
					
					 The world considers the level of space development as a yardstick for an advanced state.
					
					 Space industry is regarded as a major one in the 21st century along with IT and nuclear industry.
					
					 The DPRK has steadily advanced along the road of space development for peaceful purposes in line with the global trend of space development.
					
					 The DPRK's launch of satellites by carrier means manufactured by itself and with its indigenous technology a hundred percent is a noticeable success in the world history of space development. 
					
					 Whether a country more frequently conquers space in this age of ultra modern science and technology or not is a matter on which its fate hinges -- whether it stands on its own foot in politics, economy and military affair or relies on others.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by the fact that the U.S. seeks to dominate the world through its Global Positioning System (GPS) and different countries and regions are making efforts to develop their own system to counter it.
					
					 It is an inviolable independent right for a sovereign state to develop the outer space for peaceful purposes. 
					
					 Since the period of Cold War the U.S. has unilaterally put an embargo on the export of satellites and their related equipment in this field and has played the role of a disturber. 
					
					 It was the aims sought by the U.S. and its allies to bar other countries including anti-imperialist independent countries from putting satellites into space and monopolize it. 
					
					 The U.S. feigned ignorance of those countries meekly obedient to it launching satellites or inter-continental ballistic missiles, while disallowing those countries incurring its displeasure to launch even satellites for peaceful purposes and malignantly slandering them. This is the wicked intentions of the U.S. and its allies. 
					
					 Their application of such double standards has reached an extreme phase over the satellite launch of the DPRK. 
					
					 The history of the world space development does not know such precedent in which satellite launch for peaceful purposes has been interpreted as a missile launch. 
					
					 Only the DPRK has become the target of the U.S. and its allies' pressure and smear campaign in which its satellite launch is labeled long-range missile launch. 
					
					 The U.S. and Japan took the lead in pulling up the DPRK over its satellite launch though they have rushed headlong into space militarization, going against the trend of the times, and polluted space. Why? 
					
					 Their ulterior aim is to deter the DPRK from growing stronger in its national power and sovereignty through space development and prevent it from emerging a power at any cost. 
					
					 The DPRK's struggle to conquer space is a just struggle to achieve economic development and the prosperity of the country and defend the sovereignty of the country and the nation. 
					
					 No one can block the DPRK in its grand drive for conquering space. 
					
					 Many more satellites of the DPRK will be launched into space.

articles.title: Song Based on Kim Jong Il's Deep Loving Care for People
articles.content:
Song Based on Kim Jong Il's Deep Loving Care for People
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Female solo and mixed chorus "Song of Love for People" was included in the program of the Unhasu Concert given to celebrate the 80th birthday of the Korean People's Army in the presence of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The song's words lively represent the deep love of leader Kim Jong Il for the people, with its melody highly lyric.
					
					 It emotionally tells about the lofty outlook on the people of Kim Jong Il, who had always found his pleasure in the people's wellbeing, as well as his tireless efforts to that effect.
					
					 He was very pleased to see the people joyful at new housing units and modernly-built parks.
					
					 In reply to a request of a discharged soldier's wife whom he met in his guidance tour, he personally named her unborn baby. He also showed deep loving care for a family of road sweepers on Kubong Pass in Jagang Province.
					
					 When he heard that the building of a new theatre would shadow a nearby apartment building, he immediately took a measure to set it right.
					
					 The song says, in a word, that Kim Jong Il's lifelong efforts were devoted only to the wellbeing of the people.

articles.title: Sogwang, Newspaper Conducive to Victory in Anti-Japanese Revolution
articles.content:
Sogwang, Newspaper Conducive to Victory in Anti-Japanese Revolution
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung had paid deep attention to press activity, regarding it as a powerful means in the revolutionary struggle since he embarked on the road of revolution in his early years.
					 Sogwang was one of the publications issued during the past anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 Founded on May 3, Juche 26 (1937) as the organ of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, the weekly took it as its basic mission to arm its members with Kim Il Sung's revolutionary and military ideas, guerrilla tactics and excellent art of command and thus train them to be competent political and military cadres.
					
					 The newspaper carried "The Tasks of Korean Communists" and other works and treatises authored by the President.
					
					 It dealt in a systematic way with such theoretical and practical issues arising in the Korean revolution as the character and tasks, motive forces and targets of the Korean revolution, the worker-peasant alliance and the united front.
					
					 Given in the paper were data necessary for guerrillas' political and military study and articles on the pressing demands and immediate fighting slogans of the Korean people. And it featured heroic struggle and battle results of the KPRA and literary works including novels and poems.
					
					 The paper was widely distributed among the KPRA units and organizations of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland to encourage the guerrillas and people in the revolutionary struggle.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Observes Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday dedicates a bylined article to the 40th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification."
					 The President clarified the three principles-- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity-- when meeting the representative from the south side who came to Pyongyang to take part in the north-south high-level political talks on May 3, 1972.
					
					 The work indicates the main stand and ways for solving the issue of country's reunification by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation free from interference of outsiders to meet the desire and interests of the nation. It serves as important guidelines as it paved most correct way of achieving reunification for all Koreans who suffered from division and provided a fundamental cornerstone for national reunification, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Four decades have passed since the publication of the work but the validity, significance and vitality of the three principles of national reunification have been clearly proved as the days go by.
					
					 The three principles serve as the fundamental cornerstone that established a firm independent stand in the Korean nation's history of reunification, an inspiring banner which made it possible for Koreans to perform their duty and role as masters responsible for national reunification and an immortal programme as they provided noble guidelines for the peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un is now standing in the van of the nation's struggle for national reunification. His speech made at the military parade celebrating the centenary of the President's birth instills unshakable faith and will for national reunification into the minds of all Koreans in the north, south and abroad.
					
					 All Koreans should perform their duty and role as those responsible for independent reunification under the uplifted banner of the three principles of national reunification based on the idea of national independence and patriotism and the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration, their embodiment, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Reneging on Their Promise
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Reneging on Their Promise
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Federation for Economic Justice in south Korea Tuesday held a press conference denouncing the "government" authorities for seeking to import American beef infected with mad cow disease without let-up, according to south Korean MBC.
					 The Federation accused the "government" of refusing to keep the promise it had made four years ago, saying that it would halt the import of American beef in case mad cow disease occurs in the U.S.
					
					 The organization strongly demanded an immediate stop to the beef import for people's health.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's High Treason Censured in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's High Treason Censured in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Democratic Congo on April 26 issued a joint statement denouncing the high treason the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors perpetrated again by hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. They also supported the Korean people's just struggle. They included the Communist Party, the People's Rally for Socialism, the Workers' Party, Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Working Citizens' Association.
					 The statement expressed strong resentment at Lee Myung Bak and belligerent forces of south Korea that hurt the great leaders of the DPRK.
					
					 If any military conflict breaks out on the Korean Peninsula to entail irrevocable consequences, the south Korean ruling quarters will be held wholly responsible for them as they have pursued a hostile policy toward the DPRK, it warned.
					
					 Various political parties and organizations comprising progressive forces of Democratic Congo condemn the south Korean ruling quarters for their belligerent and reckless acts and demand them stop such acts at once, it stressed.
					
					 It urged the progressive people of the world to get united to denounce the chief culprits bringing disasters to the Korean Peninsula and turn out in the effort for the peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed in China, Vietnam
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Observed in China, Vietnam
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions were opened in China and Vietnam on April 24 on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display in their venues were works of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, photos on their exploits, photos showing revolutionary activities of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, books and photos introducing the DPRK and handicrafts associated with wisdom and skills of Koreans.
					
					 The vice-director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Heilongjiang Provincial People's Government said in his speech that Kim Il Sung was a peerlessly great man who embarked on the road of the revolution in his early years and liberated the country.
					
					 He said that the exhibition would offer the visitors an opportunity to know better about the Korean people dynamically accelerating the building of a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The curator of Ho Chi Minh Museum noted that the exhibition would greatly contribute to developing the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries on a higher level.
					
					 The permanent vice-minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism of Vietnam noted that the exhibition would help the Vietnamese people deeply know about the brilliant revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung and his exploits performed for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Significant Holidays of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Significant Holidays of DPRK Observed in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Events were held in different countries for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung, the 19th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included meetings in Tajikistan, Ecuador, Bulgaria and Uganda between April 6 and 12.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meetings.
					
					 A member of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan said that Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea and the Songun idea, ushering in a new era in history, an era of independence, when the popular masses appear as full-fledged masters of society.
					
					 He stressed that the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Il Sung would shine forever along with the human history as the sun is eternal.
					
					 The chairman of the Social Patrons Centre of the Loja City Government of Loja Province, Ecuador praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as the great leaders who extended unreserved support and solidarity to the peoples in their struggle for independence.
					
					 The secretary general of the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People noted that the DPRK would immensely prosper as it dynamically advances along the road of socialism, holding the dear respected Kim Jong Un in high esteem as its supreme leader.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Bulgaria.

articles.title: KPA Anniversary Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
KPA Anniversary Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Newspapers and magazines of different countries carried special write-ups interwoven with articles on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The No. 15 issue of Russian newspaper Patriot carried photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un, photos showing the invincible might of the KPA and an article titled "The People's Army".
					
					 The paper said that ever since its founding the KPA has demonstrated its might as ideological integral whole and united forces under the banner of the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 It stressed that Kim Il Sung firmly equipped the army and people of the DPRK with the military line for self-defence on the basis of experience gained in struggle against two imperialisms.
					
					 This line was developed in depth by Kim Jong Il and Songun politics has been carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The No. 15 issue of Russian newspaper Veteran introduced the proud course of the KPA and revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 The Iranian newspaper Iran News on April 22 carried a photo of Kim Jong Un and made a special write-up.
					
					 The paper carried an article praising the might of the KPA and also edited photos of the parade for celebrating the centenary of the birth of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The April issue of the Syrian magazine People's Army carried a photo of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il standing together and an article titled "The invincible KPA".

articles.title: Ethiopian Organization to Intensify Study and Dissemination of Juche Idea
articles.content:
Ethiopian Organization to Intensify Study and Dissemination of Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea held a meeting on its visit to the DPRK to participate in the World Congress on the Juche Idea in Addis Ababa on April 24.
					 Attending the meeting were members of the committee and its branches.
					
					 Its participants watched, first of all, a video on the World Congress on the Juche Idea and events held on the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Nigatu Dagnachew Cherinet, chairman of the committee, made a report.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the World Congress on the Juche Idea was significantly held and progressive humankind celebrated the common holiday, centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung with splendor.
					
					 He impressively told about the greatness and undying exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il, the greatness of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and the originality and vitality of the Juche idea and Songun politics in close combination with what he witnessed during his stay in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants expressed their determination to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.

articles.title: U.S. Accusations against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Accusations against DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism issued a statement on April 26 in support of the statement released by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry condemning the hypocritical acts of the U.S. and the UN which violated the DPRK's right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					 It is very ridiculous for the U.S., the strangler and wrecker of the world peace and security, to apply double standards, styling itself a judge of the missile issue, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. groundlessly asserts that other country's open launch of long-range missile does not pose a threat to peace while the DPRK's peaceful satellite launch aimed at researches into space science is contrary to the UNSC resolution. This is the unreasonable "international law" and "standards" touted by the U.S.
					
					 It claims it is "law" and "standards" if they cater to its taste but those countries advancing independently, not yielding to it, should become a target of judgment by international law. Such double standards of the U.S. are the height of the imperialist shamelessness.
					
					 Supporting the statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry, the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism strongly denounced the U.S. shameless accusations against the DPRK as an insult to international law.
					
					 No force on earth can block the independent choice and advance of the DPRK based on the Songun politics, the statement concluded.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Struggle Favored by Personages of Benin, Nepal
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Struggle Favored by Personages of Benin, Nepal
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Personages of Benin and Nepal issued statements on April 24 denouncing the hideous crimes the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea has committed by malignantly hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and kicking off confrontation hysteria against it.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Works, said that the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of the DPRK, was the holiday common to mankind and a great jubilee of the Juche idea followers of the world.
					
					 The members of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Juche idea followers of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and of General Kim Jong Il's Works, fully support and extend firm solidarity to the resolute steps of the army and people of the DPRK to meet challenges of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and defend socialism, he noted.
					
					 Phanindra Raj Pant, secretary general of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics and co-secretary general of the
					
					 Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, expressed deep concern over the serious situation created due to the reckless provocations of the Lee group against the DPRK.
					
					 He reiterated full support to the notice of the special operation action group of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army, the statement of a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry and the statement of a spokesman for the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea and extended solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to exalt their dignity before the world.
					
					 He urged the south Korean authorities to roll back the hostile policy toward the DPRK at an early date and have the U.S. troops withdrawn from south Korea.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots' Paper Calls for Implementation of North-South Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots' Paper Calls for Implementation of North-South Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- "Thongil," newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan, on April 24 carried articles calling for reunifying the country by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					 The paper said that a decisive phase will be opened for reunification when all Koreans will turn out as one to uphold and implement the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration, the banners of the country's reunification and national prosperity.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities have pursued confrontation with fellow countrymen and stepped up cooperation with foreign forces, going against those declarations, the paper noted, and continued:
					
					 Cooperation with foreign forces means one against the nation and for war. What the south Korean conservative forces have brought to the nation through cooperation with foreign forces was only the collapse of north-south relations and escalation of the tension on the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 If they persistently pursue confrontation and moves for stifling compatriots in league with foreign forces, it is impossible to improve the north-south relations and prevent a war.
					
					 It called upon the Korean nation to pool efforts and conduct joint actions against the foreign forces and anti-reunification forces.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- No matter what whole gamut of pretexts the Japanese authorities may find to evade their responsibility for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, they can neither deny the stark historic facts nor dodge the obligation for making reparation for it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 Not only those states which fell victim to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese army but the UN and allies of Japan are becoming vocal in demanding Japan make apology and reparation for the sexual slavery enforced in the past, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 If the issue of "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army is to find a proper solution, the Japanese government, the assailant, should directly admit the crime and make apology and state reparation for it.             Crafty Japan seeks to gloss over its responsibility for its past crime by letting a nongovernmental organization pay a petty amount of money to victims of sexual slavery in a form of compensation. This is another insult and mockery of those victims. They urge the Japanese government to fulfill its state and legal responsibility for the crime, instead of paying a petty amount of money.
					
					 Japan refuses even to admit its crime-woven history, prompted by its militarist wild ambition. Japan has long dreamed of realizing its wild ambition for reinvasion. It was already right after its defeat that Japan nurtured this ambition. It has become more desperate to realize it with the rapid revival of militarism. This is the main reason why the Japanese reactionaries have remained unchanged in their stance not to admit their history of aggression and crimes, lending a deaf ear to the voices of human conscience.
					
					 The world conscience demands Japan choose between the two options: to prick its own eyes itself or honestly settle its inglorious past.
					
					 Whether Japan will remain an honest member of the international community or not will entirely depend on itself.

articles.title: Noda's Support Rating Falls to Record-low 26 Per Cent
articles.content:
Noda's Support Rating Falls to Record-low 26 Per Cent
 Pyongyang, May 3 (KCNA) -- Public support for Japanese Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda's Cabinet has fallen to 26.4 percent, a record low since its launch in September and down from 31.6 percent last month, a Kyodo News poll showed Sunday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un firma cartas provenientes de varias unidades
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un firma cartas provenientes de varias unidades
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un leyo y firmo el 27 de abril las cartas que le enviaron los funcionarios y trabajadores de varias unidades, los profesores, empleados y alumnos con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Los remitentes son los profesores e investigadores de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, los empleados y pacientes del Hospital de la Escuela de Medicina de Pyongyang del mismo plantel doncente, los obreros del Complejo de Roturacion de Marismas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, los funcionarios y empleados de la Casa de Creacion Mansudae, el Comite Coreano de Taekwon-Do y la Empresa de Administracion del Parque Juventud de Kaeson, los habitantes del barrio Tongmyongsan de la ciudad de Wonsan, los maestros, empleados y alumnos de la Escuela Secundaria de Masan del municipio Waudo de la ciudad de Nampho.
					
					Ellos escribieron en sus misivas que se sienten orgullosos de ser integrantes de la nacion del Sol que cuenta con los Grandes Hombres del monte Paektu y tienen la fortuna de ser guiados por lideres y generales excelentes.
					
					Acogimos con gran jubilo la nueva centuria de la Nacion de Kim Il Sung y la Corea de Kim Jong Il, senalaron y prosiguieron que el discurso pronunciado por Kim Jong Un en el desfile militar en celebracion del Dia del Sol de este ano es un llamamiento combativo que estimula a vivir y luchar como descendientes de Kim Il Sung y soldados y discipulos de Kim Jong Il.
					
					Manifestaron la determinacion de apoyar con fidelidad al Maximo Dirigente y contribuir a la construccion de Estado prospero con elevados resultados de trabajo.

articles.title: Secretariado del CRPP publica la informacion no.997
articles.content:
Secretariado del CRPP publica la informacion no.997
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ACNC) -- El 30 de abril pasado, el traidor Lee Myung Bak se reunio con las morrallas de la "reunion consultiva de la democracia, la paz y la reunificacion".
					En esa ocasion, dijo con fanfarroneria que "se enfrentaria duro a cualquier provocacion del Norte (de Corea)" y "no desea una carrera de fuerzas armadas sino la pacifica".
					
					Y volvio a exponer su ambicion de promover el "enfrentamiento entre regimenes" al hablar de la supuesta "ola de cambio" y "corriente de la historia".
					
					Al respecto, el secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria publico el dia 3 la informacion no.997 que sigue:
					
					Esos disparates de Lee Myung Bak no tienen otro fin que recuperar su honra caida al suelo ante la furia del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC indignados por la ofensa de su maxima dignidad, calmar a sus compinches atemorizados, eludir la responsabilidad de la situacion agravada y enganar la opinion publica.
					
					Es decir, son el ultimo coletazo de los que quieren realizar a toda costa su intento de agredir al Norte practicando de continuo su ya fracasada politica de enfrentamiento fratricida.
					
					Como psicopata incurable, Lee dijo esta vez que no desea una "carrera de fuerzas armadas" sino la "pacifica".
					
					La banda de titeres surcoreanos insulta y difama ahora hasta la maxima dignidad de la RPDC como si fueran poco sus crimenes de mantener durante decadas en el territorio surcoreano a las tropas agresoras norteamericanas, realizar con ellas los ejercicios de guerra y aumentar las fuerzas armadas.
					
					Por esta razon, ella no tiene cara ni derecho a hablar de la carrera pacifica.
					
					Lo unico que falta es la liquidacion consecuente con el.
					
					Si los traidores surcoreanos desean de veras la confrontacion y guerra, los militares y civiles de la RPDC saldran al encuentro de los provocadores para hacerles probar el fuego de las fuerzas armadas consolidadas por el Songun.
					
					La banda de Lee debe portarse con prudencia teniendo presente que la RPDC le ha anunciado las medidas de accion especial.

articles.title: Conversan presidentes de Legislatura de la RPDC y la RDPL
articles.content:
Conversan presidentes de Legislatura de la RPDC y la RDPL
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 3 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, y su homologa de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, Pany Yathortou.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana la vicepresidenta de la APS, Hong Son Ok, el presidente del Grupo Parlamentario de Amistad Corea-Laos, Song Ja Rip, y otros funcionarios y por la laosiana, los miembros de la delegacion de la Asamblea Nacional, el embajador Kiettisak Keobanhdith y otros miembros de la embajada lao acreditada en Corea.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos organos legislativos y otros problemas de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador ruso
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador ruso
Pyongyang, 3 de mayo (ACNC) -- Alexandr Timonin presento el dia 3 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador de la Federacion Rusa en Corea.
					Tras recibirlas Kim departio con el representante diplomatico.
